meanings.definition: To cut off or out; excise.
meanings.sent1: She had to exscind the damaged part of the fabric to repair it.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to exscind the spoiled ingredients from the dish before serving.
meanings.sent3: In a hurry, he tried to exscind the wrong answer from his test paper.
meanings.sent4: The teacher exscinded the incorrect information from the student's report.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully exscinded the dead branches from the tree to promote growth.

meanings.sent1: Please exscind all unnecessary files from the computer to free up space.
meanings.sent2: The editor had to exscind a paragraph from the article to meet the word limit.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally exscinded the important email instead of the spam.
meanings.sent4: The detective exscinded the false leads to focus on the real suspect.
meanings.sent5: The software can exscind duplicate entries automatically to keep the database clean.
